data.title: Decoding the Message
data.solution:
message = list(input())
ans = ""
upper = "QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJKLZXCVBNM"
for i in range(len(message)):
    if message[i] not in upper:
        ans += message[i]

print(ans)
data.statement: Bob sent Sally a message through their messaging app, TEXICON, but the message arrived encrypted! Fortunately, Sally knows that TEXICON encrypts messages by inserting random uppercase letters into the text (the actual message is always in lowercase). Help Sally decode Bob’s message by removing all the uppercase words so she can read what he actually said and reply.

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn: want tIoP meAet at ABCDthe parRRk later?
testCases.testOut: want to meet at the park later?

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testIn: i doNT thAink THAT ice iAs hePaPlthy...
testCases.testOut: i do think  ice is healthy...

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn: WHy dFFo PeoPlE Love SAyIng SIX seven?
testCases.testOut: y do eol ove yng  seven?

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn: did yOU Bou fiNNniHSGsh GyPeMt A ?

data.constraints:
1 ≤ length of [[message]] ≤ 100

Each [[message]] may contain English letters, spaces, and punctuation marks.
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string [[message]], which represents Bob's message.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Bob sent Sally a message through their messaging app, TEXICON, but the message arrived encrypted! Fortunately, Sally knows that TEXICON encrypts messages by inserting random uppercase letters into the text (the actual message is always in lowercase). Help Sally decode Bob’s message by removing all the uppercase words so she can read what he actually said and reply.
Input
Line 1: A string message, which represents Bob's message.
Output
Line 1: The decoded message.
Constraints
1 ≤ length of message ≤ 100

Each message may contain English letters, spaces, and punctuation marks.
Example
Input
texicon ISVERY traPsh
Output
texicon  trash
